elements.title: Kalyani Sen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when visiting Britain during World War II, naval officer Kalyani Sen (pictured) reported that Indian women were breaking down prejudices against men and women working together by joining the military?

elements.title: Peter Boysen Jensen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the work of Danish plant physiologist Peter Boysen Jensen paved the way to the discovery of the plant growth hormone, auxin?

elements.title: 630 Ninth Avenue (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the lobby of New York's 630 Ninth Avenue is decorated with stylized movie cameras, evoking the building's original purpose?

elements.title: Sosates (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sosates was described as the "Jewish Homer", but all of his works are lost?

elements.title: Selma Mushkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that health economist Selma Mushkin estimated in the early 1970s that up to 50 percent of poor children in Washington, D.C., were affected by lead poisoning?

elements.title: Enola Holmes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after the release of Enola Holmes in 2020, the original author's estate sued Netflix, claiming that it violated copyright laws because it depicted Sherlock Holmes as having emotions?

elements.title: 2022 Camellia Bowl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Buffalo's band, cheerleaders, and radio crew were unable to make the trip to the 2022 Camellia Bowl due to a winter storm?

elements.title: a certain shrew (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a new parasite was described from a certain shrew's feces?
